    • Method Detail

      • writeValue

        public void writeValue(java.lang.Object obj)

      • writeJsonObject

        public void writeJsonObject(JsonObject jsonObject)
        Write a JSON object. Each name/value pair is output on a separate line, indented by two spaces. If the object is empty, just "{}" is appended.
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - object to append

      • writeJsonArray

        public void writeJsonArray(JsonArray array)
        Append a JSON array. If the array is empty or its elements are all simple objects (that is, literals or embedded objects/arrays that are empty), then output it all on one line. Otherwise, each array element is on a separate line.
        Parameters:
        array - array to append

      • writeIndent

        public void writeIndent()
        Append spaces for the current indent.

      • addToIndent

        public void addToIndent(int amount)
        Increment (or decrement if negative) the prevailing indent by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount to change indent
